Class Player

java.lang.Object
Entity
Player
public class Player
extends Entity
This class represents the player of the game.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int DEFAULT_HEIGHT
    This is default value of the height player's image.
    static int DEFAULT_LIFE
    This is the default value of the player's life.
    static int DEFAULT_WIDTH
    This is default value of the width player's image.
    private float endX
    This is x-coordinate.
    private float fixedX
    This is fixed x-coordinate to draw the player image.
    private int floorHeight
    This is height of the background's floor.
    private float halfX
    This is x-coordinate.
    private JumpBehavior jumpBehavior
    This is jump behavior of the player.
    private float jumpStrength
    This is jump strength of the player.
    private int life
    This is the value of the player's life.
    private long points
    This is the value of points of the player.
    private int powerFactor
    This is the power factor that player earns from power ups.
    private java.util.LinkedList<Powerup> powerups
    This is a list of power ups acquired by the player.

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_LIFE

      public static final int DEFAULT_LIFE
      This is the default value of the player's life.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_WIDTH

      public static final int DEFAULT_WIDTH
      This is default value of the width player's image.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_HEIGHT

      public static final int DEFAULT_HEIGHT
      This is default value of the height player's image.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • floorHeight

      private final int floorHeight
      This is height of the background's floor. It is constant, so it is a final variable.

    • life

      private int life
      This is the value of the player's life.

    • halfX

      private float halfX
      This is x-coordinate. Using this variable, it is checked whether the player is in the half of the window.

    • endX

      private float endX
      This is x-coordinate. By using this variable, the continuity of the 2 images printed on the screen for the background is provided.

    • fixedX

      private final float fixedX
      This is fixed x-coordinate to draw the player image.

    • jumpBehavior

      private JumpBehavior jumpBehavior
      This is jump behavior of the player. It is a low jump or high jump.

    • jumpStrength

      private float jumpStrength
      This is jump strength of the player. This depends on the jump mode.

    • powerups

      private java.util.LinkedList<Powerup> powerups
      This is a list of power ups acquired by the player.

    • points

      private long points
      This is the value of points of the player.

    • powerFactor

      private int powerFactor
      This is the power factor that player earns from power ups.

    • Player

      Player Constructor
      Parameters:
      game - Game object of the current game
      x - initial x-coordinate
      y - initial y-coordinate

    • getBounds

      public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
      This function gets the bounds of the player
      Specified by:
      getBounds in class Entity
      Returns:
      a rectangle according to the player properties(width, height, x, y)

    • loseLife

      public void loseLife()
      This functions decreases the player's life by 1.

    • addPowerup

      public void addPowerup​(int type)
      This function add the new acquired power up into list of the acquired power ups.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the new power up

    • updatePowerFactor

      private void updatePowerFactor()
      This function updates the player's power factor based on last acquired power up.

    • earnPoints

      public void earnPoints()
      This function updates the player's points. If the player's jump that is over a monster is successful, the player earns the points that are equal to the power factor.

    • setJumpBehavior

      public void setJumpBehavior​(JumpBehavior newJumpBehavior)
      This function changes the player's jump mode. (When the player acquires type D power up.)
      Parameters:
      newJumpBehavior - the new jump mode

    • getJumpBehavior

      Gets the current jump behavior of the player
      Returns:
      the current jump behavior
